message: "Bran's fate remains in doubt; Ned leaves Westeros with his daughters; Jon Snow heads north to join the night's watch; Daenerys tries to learn how to please her new husband." Anyone else watching it real time tonight?
I'll be watching it shortly after!
The opening credit music could be better...
I'm live convoring it - anyone else on?
I'm still waiting to download this episode
@Anneflo I agree that the music is a bit boring. The imagery - the map with the gears - is pretty cool though
Agreed. My take is that the map is a gameboard.
It got a little better this episode. My big complaint is that the directing is a little boring, plodding.
I'm sorry, but I just found this show boring again :/
It was better than last episode though
It's getting one more episode before I dump it
There was an amazing quote from the dwarf in it though... something like "The mind needs books like a sword needs wet stone"
@ericflo You should. Boring traveling is behind us, this is gonna be better and better. And there will be some action ;)
ok ok maybe I'll give a few more episodes :)
This episode was reallllly boring if you don't drop everything and focus completely on it
I had to watch it twice to understand that anything happened at all, but I enjoyed it a lot more the second time through
@kneath Ahh yeah, I didn't, I was browsing the intarwabs and stuff.
Totally missed it first time through
I didn't enjoy the last episode when I watched it the first time (and was fooling around on the internet at the same time)

I am disappointed that this great story is leaving people bored. But I have to admit, I felt the same way when I started reading the books. But it's such a sprawling story that after a while you become fully invested in all the characters and moving parts. Stick with it!
but I watched it again before I went to bed and it was a lot more enjoyable when it was the only thing I was focusing on
I think it just takes a lot more focus
It's a lot easier to focus on just a book than it is to focus on just a TV show for me :)

It's exactly like the first book. You have to get past the first few hundred pages of introductions and backstory to get hooked. I thought it was a great episode, especially impressed with how well they pulled off the scene where they have Arya before the king and Ned freaks out and has to kill the wolf. Exactly how I imagined it.

Agreed, the whole altercation between them and before the king was very good. The kid is doing a great job of playing Joffrey Baratheon - he's evil and petty, just as I imagined. He's being played by an actor named Jack Gleeson. I'm definitely getting the sense of the threat he becomes.
Maaan. People don't like the opening titles music? It's amazing. Everything about the title sequence(s) are.
I could listen to it on repeat.
Yea the opening title is pretty cool and music is meh
there's a lot of covers on youtube already - piano http://youtu.be/-TQKG6jhZJk guitar http://youtu.be/DRccdUkovts or heavy metal  http://youtu.be/j85vsMxZpUY
